body_html:
You don't have to use the full set of ops. If you build a static library (via bazel), you can provide a custom OpResolver with a smaller set of ops to trim the binary size. See also https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/lite/g3doc/apis.md.

We have a shared library target for the C API in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/lite/experimental/c/BUILD#L20. We'll be introducing one for the C++ API, but for now you can tweak the version_script.lds to preserve the C++ symbols.
body_text:
You don't have to use the full set of ops. If you build a static library (via bazel), you can provide a custom OpResolver with a smaller set of ops to trim the binary size. See also https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/lite/g3doc/apis.md.
We have a shared library target for the C API in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/lite/experimental/c/BUILD#L20. We'll be introducing one for the C++ API, but for now you can tweak the version_script.lds to preserve the C++ symbols.
body:
You don't have to use the full set of ops. If you build a static library (via bazel), you can provide a custom OpResolver with a smaller set of ops to trim the binary size. See also https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/lite/g3doc/apis.md.

We have a shared library target for the C API in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/lite/experimental/c/BUILD#L20. We'll be introducing one for the C++ API, but for now you can tweak the version_script.lds to preserve the C++ symbols.
